td.content: s:61 YO m cleaner presents with mild vomiting. he also reports moderate nausea, severe headache, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the mild vomiting. a short time ago he sustained a blow to the front of the head (LOC 5 min) o:Height 187 cm, Weight 64.7 kg, Temperature 37 C, Pulse 80, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 16, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:white male aged 61 yrs presents for approx. one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 5 min). he denies nausea, vomiting and headache since the accident. he has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). he has resumed usual state of function. he denies ever using cigarettes describes drinking an average of 12 drinks a week for about 8 days in his past o:Height 187 cm, Weight 64.2 kg, Temperature 36.9 C, Pulse 80, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=96,Visual Memory=95,Processing Speed=44,Reaction Time=0.48, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.
